node.title: Ed Lucas, Blind Baseball Chronicler, Is Dead at 82
node.description: Sightless since 12, he became a baseball columnist and a radio reporter. He had a unique ability to know where a ball was hit by the sound of the crack of the bat.

node.title: Join the Comedian Michelle Buteau at a Times Event on the ‘Joys’ of Parenting
node.description: Kick back and laugh about the trials and triumphs of raising tiny humans, with the comedian Michelle Buteau and Jessica Grose of The Times’s parenting newsletter at a virtual event on Dec. 8.

node.title: I Warned the Democrats About Inflation
node.description: Why didn’t they listen?

node.title: A group of Activision workers say their C.E.O. should step down.
node.description: More than a hundred employees protested at the company’s studio in Irvine, Calif., on Tuesday.

node.title: The F.D.A. plans to authorize Pfizer-BioNTech boosters as soon as Thursday.
node.description: The move would expand the number of Americans eligible for additional shots by tens of millions.

node.title: What Happens to Your Phones, Devices When Most 3G Ceases in 2022?
node.description: As major carriers like Verizon and AT&T continue moving toward 5G wireless connectivity, the end is nearing for 3G.

node.title: Protestors Rally to Demand Swifter Distribution of Almost $1B in Rental Assistance
node.description: A report from the National Low Income Housing Coalition said that the state of Georgia had handed out less than 10 percent of the aid by the end of September.

node.title: Cori Bush Says White Supremacists Shot at Protesters in Ferguson, Never Faced Consequences
node.description: The congresswoman posted a statement on social media describing white supremacists shooting at her and other protesters in Ferguson, Missouri, in 2014.

node.title: 'He died one night in the park on his own': Five deaths and a suicide should be sobering reminder of homelessness plight. But are we doing enough?
node.description: A homeless service near the Queensland–New South Wales border says six local homeless people died this year, highlighting the dire lack of housing and support for those in need.

node.title: Review finds Mycoplasma $350m bovis eradication efforts on track
node.description: An independent review of the Mycoplasma bovis eradication programme has found it is on track to rid New Zealand of the devastating cattle disease.

node.title: Increase in cargo helps drive record profit at Napier Port
node.description: Napier Port has shaken aside the effects of Covid-related disruptions and fewer ship visits to post a record full year profit.

node.title: Auckland 'children are quite excited' to return to class
node.description: Two primary schools in Manurewa are taking different approaches as pupils return for the first time in three months, with one expecting only a third of the usual number to turn up. Audio

node.title: CEO of medic company hired for Astroworld: "It was absolutely horrific"
node.description: Ten people died and dozens of others were injured in a crowd surge at the festival founded by rapper Travis Scott.

node.title: Meat prices are soaring as inflation bites U.S. consumers
node.description: Americans are paying 20% more for beef than a year ago as companies pass along higher labor and other costs to consumers.

node.title: Colorado wildfire poses "immediate and imminent danger"
node.description: The 100-acre flame, which ignited Tuesday, is believed to have been ignited by an issue with power lines.

node.title: Baylor Punctures Oklahoma’s College Football Playoff Hopes
node.description: The Sooners faced a 7-2 Baylor team that they’d beaten seven consecutive times. But instead of capturing a needed win, Oklahoma took a 27-14 loss.

node.title: Cuomo May Have to Forfeit Millions Earned From Pandemic Memoir
node.description: A New York State ethics panel revoked its approval that allowed Andrew Cuomo to write his book, contending that he broke his promise not to use state resources.

node.title: Challenges to Workplace Vaccine Mandate Moved to Appeals Court in Cincinnati
node.description: The consolidation removes the case from a Fifth Circuit panel that had blocked the Biden administration from moving forward with it.

node.title: Exclusive: Russia Lays Out Path to Stabilize Afghanistan, Avoid Another 9/11
node.description: Senior Foreign Policy Writer Tom O'Connor conducted an exclusive interview in Moscow on Tuesday with Russian special representative for Afghanistan Zamir Kabulov.

node.title: An 86-Year-Old Woman is Crowned 'Miss Holocaust Survivor' After Pageant Win
node.description: Selina Steinfeld was among 10 women, all in their 80s and 90s, who took part in the pageant in Jerusalem. "I have no words to express my happiness," she said.

node.title: 'Time Machine' of Wall Paintings Dating Back to 1500s Uncovered After Removing Plaster
node.description: The director of The Landmark Trust said she's never experienced this type of discovery in her 27 years of experience.

node.title: Biden's Vaccine Mandate in Hands of Republican Appointee-Dominated 6th Circuit Court
node.description: The case will decide on the constitutionality of mandates for workplaces with 100 or more employees.

node.title: McConnell 'Proud' of his Infrastructure Vote as Republicans who Supported Bill Face Backlash
node.description: Former President Donald Trump has slammed McConnell as an "Old Crow" for backing the $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill.

node.title: Convicted Killer Holding Hostages Arrested, Allegedly Struck Officers With Hatchet: Sheriff
node.description: After the arrest, a search revealed three people, "covered in blood," who were being held inside the accused man's home.

node.title: FDA Investigating E. Coli Outbreak Linked to Spinach
node.description: At least 10 people in Iowa, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Ohio and South Dakota were sickened in the spinach-linked E. coli outbreak.

node.title: Harry Potter stars reuniting for TV special — but JK Rowling won't be joining them
node.description: The cast of Harry Potter — including Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint — are reuniting for a special 20th anniversary TV retrospective, but author J.K. Rowling will be a notable absentee.

node.title: Federal government aims for Australia to be first country to eliminate cervical cancer
node.description: The federal government announces it will invest $5.8 million to back a pledge it made to the World Health Organization to become the first country in the world to eliminate the disease.

node.title: Victoria records 996 COVID-19 cases and nine deaths
node.description: There are now 14,260 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 433 people have died during the current Delta outbreak.

node.title: Timber shortage hits fencing contractors with weeks-long delays
node.description: A shortage of timber means some fencing companies are having to order product months in advance.

node.title: Cleveland Baseball Will Share ‘Guardians’ Name With Roller Derby Team
node.description: The settlement of a federal lawsuit will allow the Major League Baseball franchise to move forward with renaming its team, amid a reckoning over symbols of racism.

node.title: Poland Still Has Property Issues Stemming From Communist Takeover After World War II
node.description: Poland recently introduced new legislation making it harder for owners or inheritors to reclaim property seized by Communists after World War II.

node.title: Stocks Rise, But Investors Wonder if Consumers Are Trying To Stay Ahead of Rising Inflation
node.description: Consumers continue to spend even with higher prices, though analysts are concerned that consumers could eventually cut back on spending because of inflation.

node.title: ‘Aulcie’ Review: Love and Basketball, in Israel
node.description: This melodramatic documentary chronicles how Aulcie Perry, a basketball center from New Jersey, became a celebrity in Israel after he joined the Maccabi Tel Aviv team.

node.title: Health Clinic Gave 14 Kids Wrong Dose of COVID Vaccine; 2 Report Possible Side Effects
node.description: A parent of two children reported receiving double the recommended dose for kids. The mother said they were notified 10 hours after receiving the vaccine.

node.title: Dionne Warwick Jumps Into Taylor Swift's 'All Too Well' Discourse With Funny Tweets
node.description: "If that young man has Taylor's scarf he should return it," Warwick tweeted about Swift's supposed "Easter egg."

node.title: Melbourne Cricket Ground to stage 2022 T20 World Cup final
node.description: The next Twenty20 World Cup final will be held under lights at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on 13 November 2022, the International Cricket Council (ICC) said on Tuesday.

node.title: Minnesota's COVID Positivity Rate Reaches Pre-Vaccine Levels Ahead of Thanksgiving
node.description: The commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Health said the state would move to expand booster shot eligibility with or without the federal government.

node.title: Amid Sagging Poll Numbers, Biden and His Backers Embark on Tour to Tout Progress Claims
node.description: President Joe Biden spoke in New Hampshire Tuesday as he starts a tour to promote the $1 trillion infrastructure bill he signed into law Monday.

node.title: DC Mayor Muriel Bowser Decides to Drop One of Country's Most Restrictive Mask Mandates
node.description: While many indoor spaces will no longer have mask mandates, protective wear will still be required in certain settings.

node.title: Mexico Says It Arrested 'Narco Queen' in Significant Hit to Major Cartel's Finances
node.description: Rosalinda González Valencia is the wife of Jalisco New Generation cartel leader Nemesio "El Mencho" Oseguera.

node.title: Filmmaker risks safety to shoot undercover documentary about lion trophy hunting
node.description: An Australian documentary maker creates a fake identity to film big game hunters in Africa in the hope her film will help to end trophy hunting.

node.title: This tiny boy was never expected to survive. Watch him take his first steps
node.description: Born at 23 weeks, doctors moved baby Isaiah's family into the stillborn ward to say their goodbyes. Thirteen months later, the little boy continues to defy the odds.

node.title: TradeWindow to debut on NZX seeking 'a wider pool of investors'
node.description: Supply chain technology company TradeWindow will list on the local stock exchange next week, after completing a successful funding round in September.

node.title: Cabinet advised to move to traffic light system sooner than planned
node.description: It is looking increasingly likely the whole country will move to the Covid-19 traffic light system before every district health board has hit 90 percent fully vaccinated.
